html: Cowardice asks the question: Is it safe? Expediency asks the question: Is it politic? Vanity asks the question: Is it popular? But conscience asks the question: Is it right? There comes a time when one must take a position...b/c one's conscience tells one that it is right. —MLK
text:
Cowardice asks the question: Is it safe?
Expediency asks the question: Is it politic? 
Vanity asks the question: Is it popular? 
But conscience asks the question: Is it right?
There comes a time when one must take a position...b/c one's conscience tells one that it is right. —MLK

text: We need to prioritize our communities, not our foreign wars, by fully funding programs that ensure the health and safety of our families and combat record inequality. This budget is a first step but it doesn’t go far enough. That's why I voted no on this budget deal.

text: We can’t support ending foreign wars one day, then provide those wars the very funding they need. Thank you @RepJayapal, @RepBarbaraLee, @Ilhan for speaking up for restraint.pic.twitter.com/XBSVtWO7N7

html: I appreciate what we have done in this budget deal, but I believe we can do better. We can still put forward a deal that truly prioritizes the health and happiness of our communities and NOT our foreign wars.pic.twitter.com/7ytxSJCg7s

"The only thought I wake up with every day is: my child is free. My child is free to be who they are. And in that freedom comes a responsibility for us as legislators to protect that freedom. To be who they are."

-- @RepJayapal, on her gender-nonconforming child

html: As an attorney in private practice, William Barr wrote a nineteen-page unsolicited memo to Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein, criticizing "Mueller's 'Obstruction' Theory." As the attorney general, he wrote a three-and-a-half-page memo summarizing the entire investigation.
text:
As an attorney in private practice, William Barr wrote a nineteen-page unsolicited memo to Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein, criticizing "Mueller's 'Obstruction' Theory." 
 
As the attorney general, he wrote a three-and-a-half-page memo summarizing the entire investigation.

Restore #NetNeutrality
Allow authorities to stop abusive corporate practices 
Promote competition online 
Keep cash in YOUR pocket 

I am proud to cosponsor this clear, commonsense bill! Who's with me?

html: The elimination of abortion coverage restrictions in @RepJayapal's #MedicareForAll bill recognizes a simple truth: Women can never be equal members in society until we have *full* access to reproductive healthcare. We're all stronger when we stand tall for #reprofreedom.

The elimination of abortion coverage restrictions in @RepJayapal's #MedicareForAll bill recognizes a simple truth: Women can never be equal members in society until we have *full* access to reproductive healthcare. 

We're all stronger when we stand tall for #reprofreedom.

html: A: I don’t know what to say about this that really captures the heartbreak I feel. We are tearing families apart. This is a travesty of epic proportions. All I can ask is that we keep this at the forefront and demand the reunification of these families.
text: A: I don’t know what to say about this that really captures the heartbreak I feel. We are tearing families apart. This is a travesty of epic proportions. All I can ask is that we keep this at the forefront and demand the reunification of these families.

html: Q: 1,475 kids don’t just vanish. What are you doing to find these children and reunite them with their families that love them?
text: Q: 1,475 kids don’t just vanish. What are you doing to find these children and reunite them with their families that love them?

html: A: We have to do so much more. Now that we are in the majority, Democrats can write appropriation bills that really prioritize housing needs across the country, including here in Seattle.
text: A: We have to do so much more. Now that we are in the majority, Democrats can write appropriation bills that really prioritize housing needs across the country, including here in Seattle.

html: Q: Congress is not addressing the need for funding for housing voucher programs. What can be done?
text: Q: Congress is not addressing the need for funding for housing voucher programs. What can be done?

html: Q: How do you do it? A: I do it because I get to come home to you! I get to wake up every day knowing what I get to fight for.
text:
Q: How do you do it?

A: I do it because I get to come home to you! I get to wake up every day knowing what I get to fight for.

html: A: This administration has consistently vilified the LGBTQI community and we won’t stand for this. We need to do more. We will be passing the Equality Act this year in Congress.
text: A: This administration has consistently vilified the LGBTQI community and we won’t stand for this. We need to do more. We will be passing the Equality Act this year in Congress.

html: Q: What can intersex folks do to get the safe housing and community we need and deserve?
text: Q: What can intersex folks do to get the safe housing and community we need and deserve?

html: A: The lowest hanging fruit is the ability for Medicare to negotiate the prices of pharmaceuticals. That’s a bill on the table right now.
text: A: The lowest hanging fruit is the ability for Medicare to negotiate the prices of pharmaceuticals. That’s a bill on the table right now.

html: Q: Has anyone entertained the idea of a suggested retail price on a pharmaceutical drug?
text: Q: Has anyone entertained the idea of a suggested retail price on a pharmaceutical drug?

html: This president has tried to divide us, instead of uniting us and representing every person in this country. We have to stand in opposition, but we need to be a proposition policy as well. We need bold proposals.

html: “A tipped wage takes the responsibility to pay a fair wage from the restaurant owner and transfers it to the customer. The customer then has power over the worker.” — @RepJayapal #RaiseTheWage #OneFairWagepic.twitter.com/MVs15z0ZFX

html: Today we made history. Thank you @RoKhanna, @RepMcGovern, @RepBarbaraLee, @repmarkpocan, @RepJayapal, and @RepEliotEngel for your tireless work to end U.S. involvement in the brutal war in Yemen. We know there is still work to do and we stand with you. #YemenCantWaitpic.twitter.com/opSHmVRJan

html: We have a moral obligation to enact this bill, end the violence and ensure that millions of the most vulnerable people on earth not perish, but live. Proud to serve as a co-lead on @RepRoKhanna's War Powers resolution and END this unconstitutional war.pic.twitter.com/exK9bVtzd7

html: Because of the five-year war in Yemen: 20 Million Yemenis are without food 16 Million people are lacking access to drinking water 3 Million people are homeless Conditions on the ground are so bad that an official body count cannot be conductedhttps://www.vox.com/2019/1/30/18203857/yemen-war-deaths-injured-chart-intelligence …
text:
Because of the five-year war in Yemen:
20 Million Yemenis are without food
16 Million people are lacking access to drinking water
3 Million people are homeless
Conditions on the ground are so bad that an official body count cannot be conductedhttps://www.vox.com/2019/1/30/18203857/yemen-war-deaths-injured-chart-intelligence …

html: 60% of Americans don’t have $1,000 in their savings. That fact keeps me up at night. Thank you to @BrookingsInst and @EJDionne for chatting with me about how we can do more for the American people and build a bold, progressive vision for this country.pic.twitter.com/USe5OCnZZs
